data.title: Brace Sproul - Head Of Applied AI at LangChain
data.snippet:
Join Prog.AI to see contacts

### Summary

ü§©

Rockstar

Brace Sproul is Head of Applied AI at LangChain in the San Francisco Bay Area, leading applied work on agents, orchestration frameworks, and evaluation/observability after six years in software engineering. Known as a "trace tackler" at LangChain, he focuses on observability and debugging complex agent behavior while contributing to flagship open-source projects like langchainjs, LangGraph, Open Canvas, and chat-langchain. He combines product-minded full‚Äëstack engineering with prior founder and technical lead experience to translate research prototypes into polished, production-ready tooling. Brace also consults on agent design and orchestration, helping teams operationalize LLM systems and improve evaluation workflows. [...] Contributions:26 reviews, 259 PRs, 296 pushes in 5 months

Contributions summary:Brace appears to be a full-stack developer primarily focused on implementing new features and improving the user interface of the chat application. Their contributions include creating a simple chatbot functionality, refactoring existing code, and implementing new UI components. These changes span both frontend and backend aspects of the application, from the creation of content composer components to the definition of API endpoints.

data.title: Brace Sproul's Post - LinkedIn
data.snippet:
# Brace Sproul‚Äôs Post

Brace Sproul

 Report this post

üßëüíªExcited to announce Ambient Agents! Today we're releasing our first ambient agent of the week - an executive AI email assistant. This agent is built on top of a pattern we believe will be widely adopted throughout the agents released this year, and in years to come. Ambient agents are AI applications which can suggest actions to the user, then await your approval, feedback, or edits before executing the action. This pattern enables whole hosts of agent applications which would not have been fully trusted by users before, like an email assistant. Check out the free hosted executive AI email assistant here:  And the open source code here:
